channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: David Schoppik
item.description: @sls good call -- as an editor it's *so helpful* when people suggest alternative reviewers.

item.title: Albert Cardona
item.description: "A consensus cell type atlas from multiple connectomes reveals principles of circuit stereotypy and variation", by Schlegel et al. 2023 (Greg Jefferis lab at #MRCLMB in collaboration with the Bock, Murthy, and Seung labs, and also Volker Hartenstein)Interesting to me in particular, and here I see the hand of Volker Hartenstein (my postdoc adviser!), is the annotation of developmental units: the neuronal lineages (Fig 2 below).#Drosophila #connectomics #neuroscience #DevBiol

item.title: Jonathan Peelle
item.description: We have now reached the time of year when (at least in the Northern Hemisphere) it is nigh impossible to find reviewers in any timely fashion. This is good because it means some academics are taking a break üëç but if you are an author it's good to know. Personally I usually just wait until September 1 to submit things at this point.

item.title: mike johansen
item.description: probably should have run this study 30 years ago. #opioids #backpain #medmastodon"Opioids should not be recommended for acute non-specific low back pain or neck pain given that we found no significant difference in pain severity compared with placebo. This finding calls for a change in the frequent use of opioids for these conditions."https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(23)00404-X/fulltext

item.title: ‡Æê‡ÆáŒõ…îœõ∆ê…ê‚Äæ·ÑÖ¬≥·ÑÖ·ÑÖ‚Ñ¢
item.description: 1983: ‚ÄúBut for them (affirmative action laws), God only knows where I would be today. These laws and their proper application are all that stand between the first 17 years of my life and the second 17 years."2023: He votes to end using affirmative action in college admissions.

item.title: Tony Stark
item.description:
One thing I find especially sickening is the military exclusion. What SCOTUS Republicans are saying is it‚Äôs ok for Black and Brown kids to go to military academies and risk and lose their lives, but otherwise ‚Äúmake your own way.‚ÄùAs a reminder, SCOTUS obviously isn‚Äôt elected. But we do elect who appoints them. And confirms them. Affirmative action: The high cost of the Supreme Court‚Äôs decision, explained-
https://www.vox.com/scotus/23616868/supreme-court-affirmative-action-harvard-unc-students-fair-admissions-john-roberts

item.title: Albert Cardona
item.description: The connectome of the adult female fly brain, Drosophila melanogaster:‚ÄúNeuronal wiring diagram of an adult brain‚Äù by Dorkenwald et al. 2023 https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.06.27.546656v1A project that started with Davi Bock and Wei Lee developing the TEMCA for the mouse visual cortex in Clay Reid‚Äôs lab (Bock et al. 2011 https://www.nature.com/articles/nature09802), then Bock moving to #HHMIJanelia and developing the instrument much further to deliver the #FAFB volume (Zheng et al. 2018 https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0092867418307876 ), and then the Seung, Murthy and Jefferis labs automatically re-registering, segmenting and annotating the whole volume via #FlyWire and more.Extraordinary!#Drosophila #connectomics #neuroscience #brain

item.title: Kevin Mitchell
item.description:
Degrees of Freedom https://npr.org/2023/06/29/1185005974/degrees-of-freedom - I really enjoyed this interview about agency and free will on @WHYYThePulse
- yes, we really are Player One!

item.title: Ethan White
item.description: "How to make your scientific data accessible, discoverable and useful". Great piece by @jperkel on sharing scientific data (and associated code) featuring tons of great voices including @bleds22e @drkariljordan @inundata. https://doi.org/10.1038/d41586-023-01929-7

item.title: Carsen Stringer (she/her)
item.description: 'Open science, says Ellen Bledsoe @bleds22e , ‚Äúis not an all-or-nothing game‚Äù; anything you can do adds value. ‚ÄúEven if you don‚Äôt know how to go all the way to zero-to-60 open science, zero-to-20 is also really good,‚Äù she says. So, release your data ‚Äî that gives data consumers more to analyse, and data providers more opportunities for collaboration.'#openscience #neuroscienceUseful tips for data sharing by @jperkel : https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-023-01929-7

item.title: Chris Rodgers
item.description: @computingnature @jperkel @bleds22e Totally agree! I‚Äôm a big advocate for sharing. But I think being too maximalist and mandatory about it makes people feel like it‚Äôs an imposition or that they‚Äôre not qualified. Any amount is better than nothing

item.title: Total Internal Reflection
item.description: New posting! This one is about the number of unpaid hours in #academia, an insight that's come from the realisation of how much time I'm still committing despite now (currently) being unemployed. To what extent is academic research sustained by the massive expenditure of unpaid labour? How much unpaid overtime do you think you're clocking? Let's lift the lid...https://totalinternalreflectionblog.com/2023/06/29/pro-bono-a-riff-on-unpaid-labour-in-academia/

item.title: Guy Rohkin
item.description: Wanted to throw out an intro here~I'm Guy, one of the founders of https://www.scifind.net/, an expert network where scientists go to troubleshoot experimental problems. It's an #openaccess tacit knowledge database (a "lab-rary" üòÖ) of tips, negative results, optimizations, discussions, methods (stuff that's not in publication really helps get your experiments to work!) Show some love ‚ù§Ô∏è, take a look, make a post and help out :D #openscience #introduction #ScienceMastodon #biology #synbio #science

item.title: Qasim Rashid, Esq.
item.description: Affirmative action was never about admitting unqualified Black kids. It was always about ensuring qualified Black kids could also get accepted despite a world of systemic racism.The ‚Äúunqualified admission‚Äù you‚Äôre thinking of are legacy students‚Äîlike how Kavanaugh got into Yale, or how George W. got into yale, or how Kushner got into Harvard.Every GOP accusation is a confession, and this is no exception.

item.title: CMDR Yojimbosan UTC+(12|13)
item.description:
From https://isc.sans.edu/diary/Geolocating+IPs+is+harder+than+you+think/29834
...
This is one reason why Google recently started using "google.com/maps" for its "Google Maps." Users will gladly give Google Maps access to their location. After all, the map needs to know where you are to give directions. But by using "google.com/maps" instead of "maps.google.com," all "google.com" properties now have access to the user's location after the user gave access to the location on google.com/maps.

item.title: The Rob Burgess Show
item.description: Very rich hearing from Kavanaugh especially about how we‚Äôre not supposed to have help paying off our debts.

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: Can rivals come together to figure out what consciousness is? My report on the outcome of a 25-year-old bet. https://www.nytimes.com/2023/07/01/science/consciousness-theories.html
